metadata.author: G. S. Tutorial
metadata.description: Class 9 Science - Most Important 50 Questions (Selected Chapters)

question.text: Which of these has strongest intermolecular forces?
question.explanation: Solids have strongest forces → fixed shape/volume. Gases weakest → no fixed shape/volume.

question.text: The SI unit of temperature is:
question.explanation: SI unit: Kelvin (K). 0 K = -273.15°C (absolute zero). K = °C + 273.

question.text: Which of these is a pure substance?
question.explanation: Gold is element with fixed composition. Others are mixtures.

question.text: The method to separate two miscible liquids with close boiling points is:
question.explanation: Fractional distillation uses fractionating column for multiple vaporization-condensation cycles.

question.text: The number of moles in 52g of He is: (Atomic mass He=4)
question.explanation: Moles = mass/molar mass = 52/4 = 13 moles.

question.text: Which law states that mass can neither be created nor destroyed?
question.explanation: Lavoisier's law: total mass constant in chemical reaction.

question.text: The formula of calcium phosphate is:
question.explanation: Ca²⁺ and PO₄³⁻. LCM of charges = 6 → Ca₃(PO₄)₂.

question.text: Which subatomic particle was discovered by J.J. Thomson?
question.explanation: Cathode ray experiment (1897). Electron has negative charge, mass 1/1840 u.

question.text: The number of neutrons in ²³₁₁Na is:
question.explanation: Neutrons = Mass number - Atomic number = 23 - 11 = 12.

question.text: Which cell organelle is called "powerhouse of cell"?
question.explanation: Mitochondria produce ATP through cellular respiration.

question.text: The process by which Amoeba engulfs food is called:
question.explanation: Phagocytosis: "cell eating" using pseudopodia. Pinocytosis: "cell drinking".

question.text: Which tissue connects bone to bone?
question.explanation: Ligament: bone to bone (elastic). Tendon: muscle to bone.

question.text: The tissue that transports food in plants is:
question.explanation: Phloem: organic nutrients (bidirectional). Xylem: water/minerals (upward).

question.text: The SI unit of acceleration is:
question.explanation: Acceleration = change in velocity/time = (m/s)/s = m/s².

question.text: A body is said to be in uniform motion if it covers:
question.explanation: Uniform motion: constant velocity, straight line path.

question.text: Newton's first law of motion is also called:
question.explanation: Body remains at rest/uniform motion unless acted by external force.

question.text: The product of mass and velocity is called:
question.explanation: Momentum p = m×v. Vector quantity, conserved in isolated system.

question.text: Value of g on moon is about:
question.explanation: g_moon ≈ 1/6 g_earth = 9.8/6 ≈ 1.63 m/s² due to smaller mass.

question.text: Weight of object on earth is 60N. On moon it will be:
question.explanation: Weight ∝ g. g_moon = g_earth/6 → weight = 60/6 = 10 N.

question.text: The SI unit of work is:
question.explanation: Work = Force × Displacement. 1 J = 1 N·m.

question.text: Kinetic energy of mass m moving at velocity v is:
question.explanation: KE = ½mv². If velocity doubles, KE becomes 4 times.

question.text: Sound cannot travel through:
question.explanation: Requires material medium. No particles in vacuum to vibrate.

question.text: The number of oscillations per second is called:
question.explanation: Frequency (f) in Hertz (Hz). Human range: 20 Hz to 20,000 Hz.

question.text: Which crop is a kharif crop?
question.explanation: Kharif: monsoon crops (June-Oct): paddy, maize, cotton. Rabi: winter crops.

question.text: White Revolution is associated with:
question.explanation: Operation Flood by Dr. Verghese Kurien made India largest milk producer.

question.text: The process of solid directly changing to gas is called:
question.explanation: Examples: camphor, dry ice, iodine, naphthalene balls.

question.text: Tyndall effect is shown by:
question.explanation: Colloidal particles scatter light. True solutions don't show Tyndall effect.

question.text: Mass of 1 mole of oxygen molecules (O₂) is:
question.explanation: Molar mass O₂ = 2×16 = 32 g/mol.

question.text: Rutherford's alpha scattering experiment led to discovery of:
question.explanation: Gold foil experiment: most alpha passed through, few deflected → dense nucleus.

question.text: Which part of cell contains digestive enzymes?
question.explanation: Lysosomes: "suicide bags", contain hydrolytic enzymes.

question.text: The cell wall of plants is made of:
question.explanation: Cellulose: polysaccharide, provides rigidity. Fungal cell wall: chitin.

question.text: Which meristem is responsible for increase in girth?
question.explanation: Lateral meristem (cambium) causes secondary growth (thickness).

question.text: Area under velocity-time graph represents:
question.explanation: Area = displacement (vector) or distance (scalar). Slope gives acceleration.

question.text: A car accelerates from rest at 2 m/s². Its velocity after 5 seconds is:
According to Newton's second law, F =
question.explanation: F = ma. Force = rate of change of momentum.

question.text: When a bus starts suddenly, passengers fall backward due to:
question.explanation: Lower body moves with bus, upper body tends to remain at rest.

question.text: If mass of earth becomes 4 times and radius becomes half, then g will become:
question.explanation: g = GM/R² → g' = G(4M)/(R/2)² = 16GM/R² = 16g.

question.text: The value of g at center of earth is:
question.explanation: At center, gravitational pull from all sides cancels → net g = 0.

question.text: Power is defined as:
question.explanation: Rate of doing work. SI unit: Watt (W) = J/s.

question.text: 1 kWh equals:
Loudness of sound depends on:
question.explanation: Greater amplitude → louder sound. Measured in decibels (dB).

question.text: Pitch of sound depends on:
question.explanation: Higher frequency → higher pitch (shrill). Lower frequency → lower pitch (deep).

question.text: Which fertilizer is rich in nitrogen?
question.explanation: Urea (CO(NH₂)₂): 46% N. Superphosphate: P, Potash: K.

question.text: Green Revolution is associated with:
question.explanation: High-yielding varieties of wheat/rice, fertilizers, irrigation (1960s, Dr. M.S. Swaminathan).

question.text: Water has maximum density at:
question.explanation: 1 g/cm³ at 4°C. Expands below 4°C → ice less dense → floats.

question.text: The chemical symbol for potassium is:
question.explanation: K from Latin "kalium". P = phosphorus, Pt = platinum, Po = polonium.

question.text: Isotopes have same:
question.explanation: Same protons (atomic number), different neutrons. Examples: ¹H, ²H, ³H.

question.text: Which tissue is responsible for movement in our body?
question.explanation: Muscles contract and relax to produce movement. Three types: skeletal, smooth, cardiac.

question.text: A body moving with constant speed in circular path has:
question.explanation: Speed constant but direction changes → velocity changes → acceleration (centripetal) present.

question.text: The work done by centripetal force on a body in circular motion is:
question.explanation: Force perpendicular to displacement → θ = 90° → cos90° = 0 → Work = 0.

question.text: The kinetic energy of a body becomes 4 times when its:
question.explanation: KE ∝ v². Double v → KE ×4. Double mass → KE ×2 only.

question.text: SONAR works on principle of:
question.explanation: Sound Navigation and Ranging: ultrasound emitted → echo detected → measure depth.
